customer_name: Wizard of Paws Wildlife Education Inc
site_name: Wizard of Paws Wildlife Education Inc

citations.narrative:
There is an electric extension cord running up the back right corner on the inside of the genet enclosure. The genet has
direct access to several feet of extension cord that is plugged in and providing power to the lights at he top of the
enclosure. The genet may be seriously harmed, injured, or perhaps even die should it claw, bite, or otherwise
compromise the cord. Housing enclosures shall be maintained to protect the animals from injury.
Correct by: February 25, 2022

There is an excess of hair and dust in the Fox room. Clumps of hair are accumulated on and around the enclosures. A
good layer of dust and debris is present on the enclosures and other items in the room. One of the New Guinea singing
dogs has hair and urine matted to the front of his enclosure. Accumulations of hair, urine, and other debris may harbor
disease hazards, posing a threat to animal health. Enclosures and housing facilities shall be cleaned as often as
necessary to minimize disease hazards and reduce odors.
Correct by: February 25, 2022

There is an excessive amount of of clutter and stored items in the animal housing areas. Such that there is minimal
space to to work with and access the animals. Optimal animal welfare is hindered in such cramped quarters. Premises
shall be kept clean and in good repair to protect the animals from injury and to facilitate prescribed husbandry practices.
Correct by: March 18, 2022
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the president.
End Section

narrative:
3.125(a)  Repeat
   
Facilities, general. 
There is an electric extension cord running up the back right corner on the inside of the genet enclosure.  The genet has 
direct access to several feet of extension cord that is plugged in and providing power to the lights at he top of the 
enclosure.  The genet may be seriously harmed, injured, or perhaps even die should it claw, bite, or otherwise 
compromise the cord.  Housing enclosures shall be maintained to protect the animals from injury. 
 
Correct by:  February 25, 2022 
3.131(a) 
   
Sanitation. 
There is an excess of hair and dust in the Fox room.  Clumps of hair are accumulated on and around the enclosures.  A 
good layer of dust and debris is present on the enclosures and other items in the room.  One of the New Guinea singing 
dogs has hair and urine matted to the front of his enclosure.  Accumulations of hair, urine, and other debris may harbor 
disease hazards, posing a threat to animal health.  Enclosures and housing facilities shall be cleaned as often as 
necessary to minimize disease hazards and reduce odors.

Correct by:  February 25, 2022 
3.131(c) 
   
Sanitation. 
There is an excessive amount of of clutter and stored items in the animal housing areas.  Such that there is minimal 
space to to work with and access the animals.  Optimal animal welfare is hindered in such cramped quarters.  Premises 
shall be kept clean and in good repair to protect the animals from injury and to facilitate prescribed husbandry practices. 
 
Correct by:  March 18, 2022 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the president. 
 
End Section

species.scientific: Canis latrans x C. lupus familiaris

species.common: RED FOX (INCLUDES SILVER FOX & CROSS FOX)
